casebody.data:
Stevens vs. State. .Assault and Battery, i?kom Liberty. CriminalLaw. Jury and-Jurors. Husband and Wife. Witness. (Before Judge Adams.) Walter A. Way, by brief, for plaintiff in error. F. G. DuBignon, solicitor general, for the State.

[Jackson, C. J., not presiding, on account of indisposition.]

Blandford. J.

1. Where an indictment was headed “Georgia, Liberty County,” this was sufficient to show for what county the grand jurors were drawn and served, and of what county they were.

2. On the trial of the defendant for whipping his wife, she is a ■competent witness against him. Code, §§3854, sub-sec. 4573.

Judgment affirmed.
